Debugging log options. Detailed options are only visible and effective in Developer Mode.
LanguageData.BulkLoadForTransporters.Settings.Debug.L: Enable this if colonists are NOT starting bulk jobs when you expect, or ARE starting them when they shouldn't. This log tracks the "Should I work?" decision process.

Enable this if a bulk job has started, but the pawn gets stuck "waiting", doesn't pick up the expected items, picks up the wrong amount, or pathing seems inefficient. This log tracks the "What should I pick up, and in what order?" planning process.

Enable this if a pawn fails to go to an item, the unloading process fails, or an item is not handled correctly (e.g., not properly placed in inventory/hands). This log tracks the "How am I physically executing this job, step-by-step?" process.

Enable this if multiple colonists are trying to haul the same item, specific items are being ignored, or the loading progress is calculated incorrectly. This log tracks the "Who has claimed what?" concurrency state.
Settings for the core feature: loading transport pods, shuttles, etc., in bulk.
Enables the bulk loading feature for pit gates, cave exits, and other portals.
Settings for the additional feature: unloading pack animals and other carriers in bulk.
Master switch to enable or disable the entire feature of bulk hauling materials for blueprints and frames.
LanguageData.BulkLoadForTransporters.Settings.CheatIg: When enabled, any surplus items left in a pawn's hands after delivery will be forced back into their inventory, even if it makes them over-encumbered. This prevents items from being dropped on the ground, ensuring a smoother workflow at the cost of realism.
LanguageData.BulkLoadForTransporters.Settings.Constru: After completing a material delivery, a colonist will search for the next needy construction site within this radius to "chain" tasks. \nDefault: 15. Set to 0 to completely disable job chaining for construction.
Determines how nearby construction sites are grouped together for unified planning. A larger grid means colonists will plan for more sites at once; a smaller grid is more localized.\nDefault: 32x32.
LanguageData.BulkLoadForTransporters.Settings.AiUpdat: Lower values mean faster colonists' reaction but may cost more performance. Higher values improve performance.\nDefault: 60 (1 second).
LanguageData.BulkLoadForTransporters.Settings.EnableS: [Recommended] Periodically checks for and drops items from the Pick Up And Haul inventories of pawns who are incapable of hauling. This prevents items from getting "soft-locked" on non-haulers.
LanguageData.BulkLoadForTransporters.Settings.EnableC: Adds a right-click option to make colonists continuously work on loading transporters in an area until all tasks are done.
LanguageData.BulkLoadForTransporters.Settings.MinFree: Min free backpack space to unload carrier: {0}

To start a new 'bulk unload carrier' job, a colonist's backpack must have at least this much free space. This prevents pawns with nearly-full backpacks from making inefficient trips. They will prioritize unloading their own backpack first.\nDefault: 50%.
LanguageData.BulkLoadForTransporters.Settings.Reserve:
Determines if the carrier is reserved during the unloading process.

Enabled: The job is uninterruptible, similar to vanilla behavior.

Disabled: The job will be automatically cancelled if there is another task like roping needs the carrier.
LanguageData.BulkLoadForTransporters.Settings.Opportu: When a hauler has items in their Pick Up And Haul inventory, how far will they look for transport pod loading opportunities?\nDefault: 90. Set to max for unlimited (whole map) scanning.
LanguageData.BulkLoadForTransporters.Settings.Pathfin:
Controls the trade-off between pathfinding accuracy and performance. Higher values result in more intelligent routes but require more processing.

1: Colonists decide which item to pick up next based only on straight-line distance. 

2-6: Colonists first identify the N closest targets by straight-line distance, then calculate the actual walking distance for only that group to find the truly optimal target. 

Default: 3.
LanguageData.BulkLoadForTransporters.Settings.VisualU: Controls the small visual delay when processing each item into a transporter. A lower value makes processing faster.\nDefault: 15. Set to 0 to make it instant.
LanguageData.BulkLoadForTransporters.Settings.Cleanup: Interrupt bulk load jobs on save

[Recommended] This option ensures the mod can be safely removed from a save game.

When enabled, any ongoing bulk loading jobs will be safely interrupted whenever you save the game. This prevents game-breaking freezes when you load that save after uninstalling this mod.

If you do not intend to uninstall this mod, you can disable this option to prevent ongoing loading jobs from being interrupted by saving.
LanguageData.BulkLoadForTransporters.Settings.AutoOpe: When you select a transport pod or shuttle, automatically open the 'Contents' tab.
When you select a pack animal (carrier), automatically open the 'Gear' tab to see its inventory.
